item.title: Command Line Utilities
item.description:
I have recently been playing around a bit in the CLI, trying to make it more useful for me. It is one of my favorite things about Linux: the ability to make a super efficient workflow.

The best thing: you can do almost anything through scripting, which is easier and more powerful than Python.

note.zsh

This is a simple ZSH script that simpily makes a .md file, designed for Obsidian, and adds some data.

item.title: Hugo
item.description:
Basic Setup

Hugo is a tool for converting markdown to HTML. It is actually quite straight forward, too! To create a new site you simply run

hugo new site <name>

and then you have a simple site! You can create a page using

hugo new content <path/to/content.md>

For example, you could create the Markdown file “Hugo” in directory content by running

hugo new content Hugo.md
